function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i<NRA' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i<NRA' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'j<NCA' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'j<NCA' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i<NRA' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j<NCA' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'argc' affect subsequent computations?
Does the value assigned to 'argv' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Is variable 'b' live at the end of function 'main'?
Is variable 'k' live at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'int main(int argc, char *argv[])' be considered dead code?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “b[i][j]= i*j;”?
